one_reviews_text:
This was my favorite player for a long time - but the last big update with the refurbished interface, added functions, etc is a mess....

The performance when browsing through my folders changed from top to below-ground...

clarity - not existent

the comfy "exit"-button - not existent anymore

I wish I could downgrade to the last version befor that big refurbish...

update 28.05.2022:

Its getting even worse - after some minutes it just hang up - even without starting any playback...
I just get the sand glass - Picture on the screen freezes ( but still recognizes my head moving ) and my AIO starts to rev up cause the CPU does some magic Sh*t... only way to exit is Ctrl-Alt-Del...

It also doesnt make a difference between Oculus and Steam Version - both the same problem...

Maybe my 10TB are too much - maybe my directshow-LAV causes some problems with this particular player...

This has been the best app to watch movies except the the updates break everthing that make it great.  The app used work without long delays and lock-ups.  Now the app has lock-ups and inside the app watching a moving functions dont'w work.  Until this is fixed I cannot use the app any longer ( and I miss the old app).  Now I use DEO VR....This is reliable, but not as many good features.  FYI:  I would have gladly paid for this video player before the last update so long as it was self-updating...................Updated 27 May 2022, The latest update fixed this issues with panning and home screen displays for me.  I did have to un-install and re-install, but it works again now.  I wish I could turn off updates for the next update does not break something again.

It has been improving with every update.
I would like to have the option to watch 2D videos while lying down.

UPDATE :
Thanks for added flat video option. I have tried it briefly and it works fine.
It has been updated for the better.

I had a few problems playing some downloaded videos but after setting it to use DirectShow, every video i tried plays now. What would make it perfect would be if we could disable/change the background skin as it's a bit of a distraction around the playing screen, or adjust the lighting so the room is really dark, other than that, it's a great player.

Would be 5/5 with the ability to change or remove the background and adjust lighting.

I really like this VR player, especially after all the latest introduced features. The only missing feature I can think of is the compatibility with youtube's special vr360 flat format, but stereoscopic videos are the rage nowadays so I can sleep with it.

*Edit (16/2/2022): the latest update 2.0.12 broke VR180 compatibility with webm videos. Please fix it asap and, while you are at it fix also the instant recentering command and reassign it to the oculus menu button (it doesn't work at the moment and it makes no sense in the first place to assign it to the oculus button) or at least make it assignable to any key in the controller tab.


*Edit (16/11/2021): ok I got the h265 codec to work by installing the HEVC1 extension on windows store. It's worth noting that this extension is not free of charge on the store (there's a workaround you can easily find on the web though).
review_feedback:
Hello. Thank you for using PLAY'A, we are glad to hear that you have had a good experience with us. We very much value your feedback.

We have made some changes, we hope that fixed all of the issues that you have had in the past, we would love it if you can give us another review and up the review score if you find it to your liking.

one_reviews_text: As a Rift User this useless for me. why bother with clunky oculus touch or xbox controller for a point and click user interface? For watching videos the oculus remote is lightweight, has enough buttons and is much faster equipped and unequipped compared to  other controllers, just perfect for that purpose which dont need much interaction. Most other players  support the remote for a good reason...

UPDATE [1/26/22] Joy stick shortcuts and binding working now! Magic is back, such a big step for ease of use with these custom bindings, default playback 3D setting, and being able to jump to other videos without having to go back to main page and lose your place in a long list. Big moves, and thanks for the quick fix!

-------------

[1/24/22] Latest update adds a ton of super helpful control improvements... if they worked. I'm having the same issues with hand controllers joy sticks shortcuts not working anymore.

For developers who are copy/pasting responses about needing to bind keys, that is not working as the joy stick inputs are not being acknowledged for setting binds, and the default binds that are joy stick movements shortcuts are not functioning in-app either (but joy stick vertical scrolling on list views works fine). If you're looking to reproduce - I'm on quest 2 air link on win10. I've tried reinstalling the app, that did not help. 

Once this gets fixed, I'll jack the rating back up, because otherwise, this is the best VR video player (when it works). New update bugs just made it a rough experience.
review_feedback:
Hello. Thank you for using PLAY'A, we are glad to hear that you have a good experience with us. We very much value your feedback.

Thank you so much for updating your review, we appreciate it!

one_reviews_text:
tried the build in video browser and was really dissapointed . some videos straight up dont work and the others i tried just stutter and often stop playing just after a few secondes.     
quality of the videos also didnt seem that great from the short moments i saw.
in some you feel like sitting in a box where the video is projected onto each inner surface of the box you sit in and it doesnt look good.

review_title: Much wow!  But not quite Pigasus yet.
one_reviews_text:
I highly recommend this app.  It is really excellent.  Pigasus is still a little better though.  Could you guys make a couple changes?  

1) A-B loop 
2) looping in general
3) The seek bar is tiny.  You have to be a sniper with your controller.

Update: I mentioned this a while ago but you guys still haven't improved it.  The seek bar width - please increase it!  You just gotta go into the properties tab and change the width right?  It can't be that hard.  It should take 5 seconds to change the width on that seek bar.
review_feedback:
Hello. Thank you for using PLAY'A, we are glad to hear that you have had a good experience with us. We very much value your feedback.

The new feature of the seek bar was checked and should be added on our next update, thank you for your suggestion.

1+ 2 will be checked, thank you.

one_reviews_text: Got a new Quest 2 a few weeks back and tried several free and paid video players.  This one is the best.  No issues with audio like some of the others, plays SBS and UD 3D no issues.  Select flat, 180 or 360.  The only con I have is that the controllers don't seem to fully work with it, you use the dot on headset to select settings or actions.  You can flip pages or folders but the button layout is not intuitive (at least for me).  Other media players have sound issues (since V29?) during video itself but sound returns after out of video.  At least this media player does not have these issues.  Well done folks.
review_feedback:
Hello. Thank you for using PLAY'A, we are glad to hear that you have a good experience with us. We very much value your feedback.

We were happy to read your feedback, we will check in regards to the controlers and have it fixed once we find the issue!

one_reviews_text:
For anyone having issues playing certain videos (you are likely trying to play HEVC/H.265 videos), look up "codecguide media foundation" and install a free version of the HEVC codec, this should hook you right up. I wish the app told you about that... 
Performance wise it works well and seems to do a good job at automatically detecting video properties, but it lacks more advanced image adjustment settings other apps have, doesn't seem to support looping, doesn't let you remap buttons and resize UI elements (scrolling through the video is challenging since UI is so small). Has potential though, looking forward to improvements :)

one_reviews_text:
There weren't better alternatives.  It opened up and loaded a video just fine.  The environment is decently immersive.  The video monitor is just big and close enough for a good picture.

I'd appreciate an option to turn off the piercing confirmation noise that pings every single time you click an icon or option while navigating menus.  And having no option to switch language tracks is a deal breaker for me.
review_feedback:
Hello,

Thank you for using PLAY'A we will do the adjustments as you suggested and hope that you can give us a better review and keep on using PLAY'A as your main VR App.

one_reviews_text:
I got on pretty well with this player with 180 degree videos.  I like how I could adjust the picture position easy (tilt, height and depth) using the controller-joysticks to get the picture into the perfect spot for the most realistic and intimate experience ;-)

It was fine for watching regular videos too.  

I have the following gripes:

- It doesn't support Local network drives (You have to map the network drive as a local disk)
- It doesn't remember where you last were in the video so if you exit the video and then play again it starts from the beginning (This is how traditional video players worked, but in the age of Plex and Netflix people are used to picking up where they left off)
review_feedback:
Hello, Thank you for using PLAY'A we will do the adjustments as you suggested. 
We hope that you will keep on using PLAY'A as your main VR App.

one_reviews_text: 10/10 for 3D Movies

review_title: Picture Not as Good as Deovr
one_reviews_text: I keep looking for a player that has surroundings but which has a picture equal to DeoVR but can't find one. I am not sure why we have such a huge choice of players.  At the moment I usualy use Virtual Space for Youtube, pictures etc as I like the surroundings and DeoVR for movies, 360 videos etc. Can't really see what this adds to the numerous other ones available.

review_title: Good player with room to improve
one_reviews_text:
I like the player, but there's room for improvements, especially regarding the Oculus controls. First, i would suggest to turn off the background music, this drives me totally mad. Except from this the overall interface is very nice and fast to use.

5.7K H265 videos are playing except for skipping with the controller, which seems to speed up the video like fast forward. Some clips are playing choppy.

There is no way to skip videos with the controller during playback, so you always have to get back to the menu and start the next clip, which is really annoying, especially with the background music starting everytime and the page is reset to 1, which is unuseable!

Like with other VR players, there should be a way to navigate and control with one controller incl. skipping clips.

I would suggest the following controls during playback (maybe as an option to select in the settings):

- Front trigger : select
- A : back to lobby
- B : play / pause
- Thumbstick press : mono / stereo
- Thumbstick left / right : seek video
- Thumbstick up / down : Volume up / down
- Back trigger + Thumbstick left / right : previous + next video
- Menu button : quick recenter

There are some other options too, e.g. the zoom controls, which are set on the second controller. Usually you don't play videos with two controllers, so there could be a way to reverse the controller options, so if you press back trigger + menu the controls are switching between left and right controllers.

I would also suggest to increase the size of the onscreen navigation, since the timeline is hard to touch if it's that small.

Also if you go back to lobby with the A Button it would be nice to get back to the video at the same position by pressing A in the lobby again.

List mode in the browser would be nice too as well as random playback (e.g. for music videos).

I think with having some of these included the player is well worth five stars.
I have no problem running over 4k, as others complain about. Everything runs smooth with high quality on the image. I'm missing an option to scale the screen. Supersampling would allso be great.
Very good player!
review_feedback: Hello. We are glad to hear that you like our App. Thank you for your kind review.

review_title: Can't visit websites other than playavr?
one_reviews_text: Every time I try to visit a website like youtube.com or google.com (for instance) it fails.  The only website I've been ble to visit is playavr.com.  Not sure why. This one thing so far makes this player not as intutive as other players such as GizmoVR.  I'll adjust my review when this player start making sense to me.

Best VRPlayer, Best VR experience. But i can't play greater 4K Videos.
By 5K i have Fractals or a Loading Screen and by 6K Loading Screen only.
Whats is the Problem? Hard,Software is:
Initialize engine version: 2018.4.2f1 (d6fb3630ea75)
GfxDevice: creating device client; threaded=1
Direct3D:
    Version:  Direct3D 11.0 [level 11.1]
    Renderer: NVIDIA GeForce RTX 2080 Ti (ID=0x1e07)
    Vendor:   
    VRAM:     11049 MB
    Driver:   26.21.14.3160
review_feedback: Hi Gore. Thank you for a great feedback. In order to play 6K videos, you are most likely need to install HEVC codec. Here is a link for it: https://www.microsoft.com/en-us/p/hevc-video-extensions-from-device-manufacturer/9n4wgh0z6vhq?activetab=pivot%3Aoverviewtab

Just downloaded Play’a yesterday, so i can’t be completely objective here. 

Pros: i have no technical problems with this app, so i think i can give a good rating for the app developers who created it. 

Cons: Play'a has a background music and it's annoying. But thank god you can turn it off. 
Some suggestions to make the app better: if you make the elements of the navigation bigger. At the moment it's too small and not very convenient. So i put 4 stars not 5. Other than that, everything is good. Sorry. Once changed, i’ll adjust my rating.

Before Play’a i used SkyboxVR and GizmoVR. But they both have a lot of small bugs which drove me crazy sometimes. Keep up the great work, just remove that annoying music lol.

Thank you guys i still use Playa app and i like it. Five stars guys!

one_reviews_text: In my opinion right now it is the best VR player on the market and there are plenty of things to prove that. It works with mouse and keyboard, gamepad and Oculus Touch, it supports most of new VR headsets in seated and standing mode and you can also use it on your smartphone and/or PC. It runs 4K, 5K, 6K and 8K ULTRA HD and I did not have any issues when trying some 360 and 180 virtual reality movies on it – and it also works for 2D, too!
